cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi SSE of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift north-northwest today, turn west-northwest on Monday, then accelerate northwest across the Yucatán Channel into the central Gulf of Mexico and toward the north-central Gulf Coast (LA-MS-AL) by late Wednesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeast Louisiana–Mississippi Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tulum to Río Lagartos (Yucatán) and Cozumel; Pinar del Río Cuba
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: 28% chance of 34-kt (tropical-storm) winds and 8% chance of 50-kt winds at the port, with peak winds expected late Wednesday–early Thursday as Zeta comes ashore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 3–5 ft above ground level is possible along the Mississippi coast, including Pascagoula, around the time of landfall.
weather_observation.rainfall: Storm-total rainfall of 4–8 inches with locally higher amounts could occur, producing flash-flood potential in the Pascagoula area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and high waves in Pascagoula Channel; brief tornado threat in outer rain bands; possible port closures and navigation restrictions.
